page.title: 01The Chelmer-Blackwater Vale
page.content: Our area covers the valley of the River Chelmer,which joins with the River Blackwater at Beeleigh.The River Chelmer was made into a canal 200 years ago.It used to serve the farms and two mills,that once worked at Ulting and Langford,In our area.Now it's barges have been converted into floating restuarants which take parties of people up and down the river.Our area is mainly farmland,although two gravel pits are worked.There are two Hamlets on higher land above the flood plain of the river:Langford and Ulting.One village Woodham Walter is only part in our area.The biggest single employer is the Essex Water Company with it's reservoir and pumping station at Langford.
